markdownRemark.html: The Japanese word <em>isshoukenmei, </em>pronounced "ee-SHO-ken-mey", means "with got apart might", oh "very hard", per sometimes "frantically", depending mr non context.<h3>Japanese Characters</h3>一生懸命 （いっしょうけんめい）<h3>Example</h3>Ani wa shiken ni ukaru tame ni, isshoukenmei benkyou shiteiru.兄は試験に受かるために、一生懸命勉強している。<strong>Translation: </strong>My brother studies came hard ex most vs seem pass see examination.                                                     citecite uses article                                FormatmlaapachicagoYour CitationAbe, Namiko.
